column8: PAS is distancing itself from its former deputy president after an Opposition politician alleged he had received money from Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak.PAS secretary-general Datuk Takiyuddin Hassan (pix) said his former colleague Datuk Dr Nasharudin Mat Isa, who lost in the 2011 party elections, has not held any post in the party since his membership in the Ulamak Syura Council was terminated in 2013."Therefore, PAS has no knowledge of nor is privy to any information on the allegation by Rafizi Ramli, who is trying to implicate PAS in his claims,” he said."Since he had left the party that year (2013), the only monies we received from him were the monthly contributions as a PAS Member of Parliament, and that ended in May 2013."We have had nothing to do with him nor received any funds from him. PAS cannot be implicated in this issue,” he said in a statement on Thursday.Earlier Thursday, PKR vice-president Rafizi Ramli had alleged in a statutory declaration (SD) that Nasharudin received funds from SRC International Sdn Bhd, a former 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) subsidiary.Rafizi claimed to have received his information from an unnamed former senior officer of the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) who had led the 1MDB investigation, and who has since retired.Takiyuddin, also the Kota Baru MP, said PAS would leave it to the authorities to investigate Rafizi’s SD.However, he added the allegation is merely hearsay unless the individual who is the source of the information comes forward to back his claims.Nasharudin is now chief executive officer of the Global Movement of Moderates. He was Yan MP from 1999 to 2004 and Bachok MP from 2008 to 2013. He was PAS deputy president from 2005 to 2011.He was also a key proponent of the “unity government plan” with Umno, an idea that was eventually scuttled.He was dropped from the Ulamak Syura Council in 2013 for allegedly going against several council decisions.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...0J160e2fUy8r.99
